node module

class node.Node

Bases: object

Node class that implements the following native python functions: addition, subtraction, multipliation, division, unary operators, and power. Depending on the implemented funtions, Node will check if the inputs are of type integer, float, or Node. If they are of tyep Node, then a new Node will be generated to be the parent of inputs and be returned. If the values are of type int or float, then the values are first convered to Node class by calling valNode, and be operated in the same way as when the inputs are of type Node.

add

Addition implementation for Node class.

sub

Subtraction implementation for Node class.

mul

Multiplication implementation for Node class.

div

Division implementation for Node class.

pow

Power implementation for Node class.

pos

Positive unary operator for Node class.

neg

Negative unary operator for Node class.

node.arccos(a)

Implements inverse cosine function to contribute to a computational graph. Converts integers and floats to Node’s, and inserts derivatives into the computational graph.

Parameters

a (int, float, Node) – Value to be calculated through arccos.

Returns

Node with values and derivatives along with a corresponding computational graph.

Raises

TypeError if value is not of type int, float, or Node. –

class node.funcNode(func, leftdf, rightdf, left, right)

Bases: node.Node

Sets intermediate variables as funcNode class to memorize the functions needed to represent the final output function. funcNode class overrides native python functions and unary operators, in order to construct a sequential computational graph, based on which the users can auto-differentiate the functions they are interested in.

val

Current value of the intermediate variable.

Type

int, float

func

The arithmetic function executed to calculate the intermediate variable.

Type

callable

leftdf

The arithmetic function to calculate the partial derivative of the current node

Type

callable

with respect to its left child.
rightdf

The arithmetic function to calculate the partial derivative of the current node

Type

callable

with respect to its right child.
left

Left child of the node.

Type

Node

right

Right child of the node.

Type

Node

forward()

calculate function value and derivatives with forward mode. :param self: The current node. :type self: Node

Returns

The value of the function der (dict): The dictionary containing all the partial derivatives of the functions with variable names as keys.

Return type

val (float)

forward_pass()
reverse()

calculate function value and derivatives with reverse mode. :param self: The current node. :type self: Node

Returns

The value of the function der (dict): The dictionary containing all the partial derivatives of the functions with variable names as keys.

Return type

val (float)

reverse_pass(partial, adjoint)

class node.valNode(name=None)

Bases: node.Node

Sets variables as valNode class, which allows the users to auto-differentiate functions that use them. valNode class overrides native python functions and unary operators, in order to construct a sequential computational graph.

val

Current value of the variable.

Type

int, float

name

The name of the variable.

Type

str

der

Derivative of variable, which is used in the reverse mode.

Type

int, float

forward()

Executes a simple forward pass for a single node.

Returns

Current value and empty derivative if no name. Otherwise returns the value of the specified valNode and derivative 1.

forward_pass()
reverse_pass(partial, adjoint)
set_val(val)

Alias for _set_val(self, val). Sets the numeric value for a valNode.

Parameters

val (int, float) – numeric value of the valNode.

node.variables(name, size=None)

initialize independent variables for the function of interest

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name to identify the variable.

  • size (int) – The size of the variable.

Returns

vector when size > 1 valNode when size = 1 or None

class node.vector(*args)

Bases: object

Combines several valNodes together to support vectorized input variables. vector and valNode share the same syntaxes for .set_val, .der and ._reset_der. Every single element in the vector variable can be indexed.

property der
evaluate()

evaluation for vector functions Return: The vector values of the vector function.

grad(var)

auto-diff for vector functions currently we only use reverse mode to calculate gradient for vector functions :param the variable or vector variables var: :param which is used to define the function: :param and for which we need to calculate the derivatives:

Return: Jacobian matrix

set_val(array)

set the value of the vector variable. :param array: A list of value to be set for the vector. :type array: list

Returns

None

Raises

ValueError if the input size does not match the vector size. –
